comments.title: The Go Library handle common function
comments.description:
When I develop applications with Golang, there are pretty restrictions on the Go library. It has pretty few, and I must write common function examples: find, filter, check existing elements,...
I see Lodash as a popular and widely used JavaScript utility library that provides a comprehensive set of functions to work with arrays, objects, strings, functions, and more. So, I wrote go-dash based on Lodash, but it will have a version upgrade and have its own roadmap. We always write the code for the go-dash with the coverage of unit tests equal to 100 percent.
There are some examples of go-dash. You can use it with all Go versions. You can find all functions about: arrays, collections, dates, math, lang, numbers, and strings in the library. I hope everyone who can contribute to the go-dash will help make it more popular, flexible, and stable.
When you use it, if you feel it is useful to you, then comment and upvote it. Thanks.
Check it üëâ https://github.com/warriors-vn/go-dash

comments.title: The Go Library handle common function
comments.description:
When I develop applications with Golang, there are pretty restrictions on the Go library. It has pretty few, and I must write common function examples: find, filter, check existing elements,...
I see Lodash as a popular and widely used JavaScript utility library that provides a comprehensive set of functions to work with arrays, objects, strings, functions, and more. So, I wrote go-dash based on Lodash, but it will have a version upgrade and have its own roadmap. We always write the code for the go-dash with the coverage of unit tests equal to 100 percent.
There are some examples of go-dash. You can use it with all Go versions. You can find all functions about: arrays, collections, dates, math, lang, numbers, and strings in the library. I hope everyone who can contribute to the go-dash will help make it more popular, flexible, and stable.
When you use it, if you feel it is useful to you, then comment and upvote it. Thanks.
Check it üëâ https://github.com/warriors-vn/go-dash

comments.title: The Go Library handle common function
comments.description:
When I develop applications with Golang, there are pretty restrictions on the Go library. It has pretty few, and I must write common function examples: find, filter, check existing elements,...
I see Lodash as a popular and widely used JavaScript utility library that provides a comprehensive set of functions to work with arrays, objects, strings, functions, and more. So, I wrote go-dash based on Lodash, but it will have a version upgrade and have its own roadmap. We always write the code for the go-dash with the coverage of unit tests equal to 100 percent.
There are some examples of go-dash. You can use it with all Go versions. You can find all functions about: arrays, collections, dates, math, lang, numbers, and strings in the library. I hope everyone who can contribute to the go-dash will help make it more popular, flexible, and stable.
When you use it, if you feel it is useful to you, then comment and upvote it. Thanks.
Check it üëâ https://github.com/warriors-vn/go-dash

article.description: If you type in "cannibalization" on Google, most of the results will advise you on how to prevent it. I mean, you should be making more sales, not having the same ones distributed across two products. That's a no-brainer, right?
